title: Unable to connect to pvp server
body: For some reason I cant connect at the login screen.  It was working yesterday on the same computer and network. idk what it is.  Any thoughts?

replies.body:
Can I ask you to attempt now and let me know if there has been any change.

Thanks
You fixed it for me!!! TY
mine is fixed now too
Thanks for the information. I think I've been able to isolate this to a connection with Centurylink/Qwest in Dallas. We are contacting the team over there now to look into this.

> [{quoted}](name=Korensky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-08-04T19:42:33.084+0000)
>
> Thanks for the information. I think I've been able to isolate this to a connection with Centurylink/Qwest in Dallas. We are contacting the team over there now to look into this.

NewWave communications, Taylorville IL

Hello,

Who is your Internet Service Provider and what location are you in?

Thanks

Eatel Prairieville, Louisiana
seems like all LA people having troubles lol

Eyyy, I'm not the only one who plays League out here, lol.

But yeah, Eatel Prairieville, Lousiana. Same issue as OP.

Can someone at least make an update it on the status.leagueoflegends.com/#na page? It might be more helpful for some of us to know there are widespread connection issues, rather than the fact GP is still disabled for story reasons.

Since yesterday, I have been having issues logging in, the client hardly connects, and when I did get into a game, it was sitting at around 900 ping. I saw others having similar issues and it is only happening with League and nothing else for me. I hope this trace helps in some way.
I am still unable to log on
I am having this problem as well. I have Entouch Internet. Houston Texas
I am also from lafayette,LA on LUS. My friend and I are getting to logging in.... then it gives us an error, been like this for about 3 hours now. HELP! =D

Just got home from work, can't connect either...joy.

Live in Houston texas, Century Link internet.

> [{quoted}](name=dzell,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-08-04T19:23:35.340+0000)
>
> LUS Fiber (municipal, think it goes through QWEST), Lafayette, LA

I wonder if the hub in mid-LA is having a hiccup.

Hi all, 

I was to able to play yesterday but now I can't connect to the PvP server what so ever. I did the basic how to fixes but nothing so far has worked... Any suggestions??
I live am having the same issue as some of the people posting about this.  I am also from Louisiana.
Issue has reappeared for me since day after 5.15 patch came out
any new developments?

Live in Statesboro, GA. I have been having the same problem. Last night I was playing fine and then around 10 PM last night I could barely connect to the client, then it would kick me out of games for not choosing a champ even though it was not my turn. Has been doing this all day and I even redownloaded the client. My connection to the internet is fine, it's only this game.
The chat is now connecting and I am able to access the store.
For those of you having chat issues, is store working?
I just logged in again and I am now connected to the chat. The store is working fine too.
Here's another trace, see attached image. Albuquerque, NM; xfinity (comcast). {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

> [{quoted}](name=EMR,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2015-08-04T23:20:40.697+0000)
>
> Here's another trace, see attached image. Albuquerque, NM; xfinity (comcast). {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Hello,

The trace route shows that you can communicate with our login servers directly so I don't think there's a network issue at play here.  Is this still ongoing?

> [{quoted}](name=Korensky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=00130001,timestamp=2015-08-04T23:50:20.150+0000)
>
> Hello,
> 
> The trace route shows that you can communicate with our login servers directly so I don't think there's a network issue at play here.  Is this still ongoing?

Sorry, I didn't read the OP message very clearly. I am unable to connect to the chat, but I am able to login.

> [{quoted}](name=EMR,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2015-08-04T23:20:40.697+0000)
>
> Here's another trace, see attached image. Albuquerque, NM; xfinity (comcast). {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Note that I am having the unable to connect to pvp server error, if that wasn't implied.
Can't connect to chat :c Comcast / Houston, TX
Korensky,  I am having the same issue.  I'm located in Colorado and I have centurylink.
Yeah I am in CO too and the chat wont connect.
I'm having the same problem here too. CO as well.
I have three friends in Albuquerque NM who cannot connect to chat as well. This happened to them yesterday as well, but it came back eventually.

i can connect at the login screen but after champion select this thing tell me that im unable to connect. please check your internet connection and gives me an option to reply i already tried several times and other stuff and nothing. i have 3 leaves for it

That sounds like a firewall issue, I can save you the first generic reply from support.

http://s16.postimg.org/s0l15t3wl/lol_example_120.png

> [{quoted}](name=Arubaro,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jqs0ENKH,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2015-08-04T22:02:41.430+0000)
>
> i can connect at the login screen but after champion select this thing tell me that im unable to connect. please check your internet connection and gives me an option to reply i already tried several times and other stuff and nothing. i have 3 leaves for it

This will be a different issue - sorry but you may be best contacting player support directly if this persists.

Just an update that we are still working with Centurylink/Qwest on trying to isolate the specific cause of this. It is very limited in scope and impact so identifying the exact node is proving difficult.

I'm on Verizon in PA.  I just played a game with random 5 minute disconnects happening for every 3 minutes of gameplay.  Have you seen anything about them?  I tried to get info from them on what the hell is going on but since it's Verizon, they don't care nor can they provide any form of useful information.

I am having the same issue... but mine has been going on for a few days now. I live in Woonsocket Rhode Island and use Cox Communications as an ISP.

Mines fixed!

Can I request two pieces of information for those who know how to use these tools and capture it. This will help us check the path your ISPs are taking back towards our login servers.

Windows (from a command prompt):
tracert 192.64.174.65
telnet 192.64.175.65 2099

OSX (from a terminal window):
traceroute 192.64.174.65
telnet 192.64.175.65 2099

Thanks
